noun.description: A persistent feeling of ill will or resentment resulting from a past insult or injury.
examples: she held a grudge against her former boss

verb.description: Be resentfully unwilling to give, grant, or allow (something)
examples: he grudged the work and time that the meeting involved

phrases: I hope you will not bear me a grudge
perhaps Maria bears a grudge against him for that very reason
origin: Late Middle English: variant of obsolete grutch complain, murmur, grumble, from Old French grouchier, of unknown origin. Compare with grouch.
